error.notes: Due to an error in the design and installation of third-party software

asset.notes: Following enumerations present before veris 1.3.3 removed: asset.governance.Unknown.

confidentiality.notes: An unauthorized individual gained access to systems used to store ePHI on multiple occasions over a period of 10 months. Affected individuals had a limited amount of PHI exposed on CDs containing X-ray images that were provided to patients.  No Social Security numbers, medical information, Driver's license numbers, or insurance information were exposed, although affected patients did have their name, medical record number, date of birth, and gender exposed as a result of the error.

discovery_notes: The issue involved x-ray CDs that were provided to patients at AFC's Alabaster, Flintridge, and Wetumpka, Alabama clinics, and Smyrna, Tennessee clinic, between the dates of August 26, 2015, through June 14, 2016. Org sent notification to patients July 29th, 2016
summary: American Family Care notifies 7,200 patients of breach involving PHI   An unauthorized individual gained access to systems used to store ePHI on multiple occasions over a period of 10 months. Affected individuals had a limited amount of PHI exposed on CDs containing X-ray images that were provided to patients.  American Family Care conducted a thorough investigation and determined that there was a fault with the design and installation of third party software which resulted in the PHI of patients being exposed.  The breaches of PHI occurred at four American Family Care Clinics
